resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
I'm using arrow/cpp into my cpp project and got this compiling issue. I'm not sure where this issue comes from. I don't have it on MacOS. Can anyone help to point out the problem?
{code:java}
E:\Source\emotivpro\EmotivPro\thirdParty\Parquet\src\ThirdParty\arrow\cpp\src\arrow/util/hash.h(32): warning C4003: not enough actual parameters for macro 'max'

comments.body: I think you may be hitting issues addressed in https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/53e359b850afda0a39f0469cb5f54a3e6a4701fb/cpp/src/arrow/util/windows_compatibility.h
[~thamha] Do you still get this issue or can we close?
[~pitrou] we don't get this issue anymore. We fixed it by using forward declaration and let arrow header files be private in .cc file.
